channel.name: Consume specific proof inside SmartContract method

messages.content: Following the example above, both proofs are verified. I want to make sure that only `MyProgram` proof is verified, and `otherProgram` proof is not accepted and verified.
youâ€™re not proving the smart contract method, you must create a tx and then tx.prove()
Hm, its that simple 😄 okay, let me try and confirm this.
hm, it would be interesting to fix that by doing out-of-circuit (full) verification in the non-proof case

yeah but rn just addProofs in tx.prove() does actual proving right, we just had this discussing in the morning about decorators not changing return types of methods - concern in case of smart contract methods
mm i'd expect .prove() to fail already, i want to suggest try .send() as well but that makes no sense to me
are the verification keys of the programs identical?
they should not be, since you assert against a different constant each time
I checked and they are different.
but i think thats probably the bug here for some reason that @gregor can explain
hmm ok so that part works
can't explain this. will get someone to investigate
Sending the txns did not change anything.

Ok so I confirmed that the proof with a different proof as input should **not** succeed.
Matthew (our crypto architect) created a test which shows that in Pickles called from OCaml, this behaves as expected: https://github.com/MinaProtocol/mina/compare/testing/mixing-proofs?expand=1

So we'll have to investigate what o1js does wrong that makes this proof succeed.

Thanks @ioWxss6 for the diligence and for bringing this to our attention!
